reviews.review_msg: Scott makes an effort to help his students when in need, he also goes over assignments in class which is helpful so you can see what you may have made a mistake on. The course is not easy, but Scott tries to make content engaging and relevant which is helpful. Great professor in all. Assignments are fair, exams meant to be fair but can be hard

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE!!! There is no support given to students who take HSCI 330 online. The TA was useless and the resources given did not help with assignments or exams. If you want to do well in this course take it in class.

One of the best profs at sfu. He tells you EXACTLY what you need to do to excel in the course. Two projects worth 20% each. Find a study group and do them an it's an easy A+ on both assignments. He gives you his speech notes as well so in case you miss class you know what he said. The examples he gives in class are REALLY helpful so go to class.

I loved the class and his lectures. Extremely clear and concise lectures, this guy knows his stuff. I found that joining study group helped for assignments and studying to bounce ideas off. Some of it is conceptual and you really need to have a handle on material for his tests. He is very available after class (finishes early) for questions.

great lecture slides and organized class, it would be good if you did the readings and chapter questions before attending class to understand what he is saying better. 1st assignment was fair but 2nd assignment was hard. Exams are quite fair but you need to know your stuff. Scott is really helpful and friendly and replies quite quickly to emails.

AMAZING PROF! I attended class maybe 3 times the whole semester and still ended with an A-. For midterm and final ONLY study the learning objectives and not all the extra readings assigned. Highly recommend Scott because he clearly states what will be tested on. Only 2 assignments, worth 20% each but both were fairly easy. Overall, easy A class!!!

Scott is a wonderful professor. He doesn't require students to attend the classes all the time. But if u go to his class, u will notice the lectures are short but clear. He gives a lot extra time for students to ask questions and he is patient. U can discuss the homework with other classmates. Through the homework, u can understand the content more

Dr. Venners is the definition of an excellent professor. He is VERY clear about what he expects of you (every lecture has learning objectives - know those and you will be fine for the tests!). The class is well organized on WebCT. He is really passionate about Epi, makes it very relevant and wants students to succeed. Highly recommended!
Great prof. Explains course material very clearly, and reviews upon request. He has a good attitude and is an easy going guy.

Scott can teach. It's unfortunate that he's a victim of FHS incompetence (as were students this semester). Last semester he was too easy; this semester too hard. Lousy textbook! Shame, because it's an interesting subject.

Dr Venners is the best!  He definitley puts the students first and is always available to help you out if you need it.  The assignments and exams are very straight forward.  The material is not super easy but Dr venners makes it very relevant!
